Articles.Content:
***windows\_x\_seven.exe has stopped working***

Now, seriously. How awesome is that?

I've been waiting for this for a loooong time. Thanks for letting us know!

I assume there's no complaint with this being the home of the first ever Macey Hypetrain ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ?

I'll even drive it if the crowds desire a conductor...

\*chugachugachugachuga-SPIRIT OF KERBIN!\*

> [Just gonna chuck this reference in here and get back to construction overdrive.](%7Boption%7D)

[hehe.](%7Boption%7D)

[I'm glad we finally found out what happened to Shelbus.](%7Boption%7D)

[Am I the only one who rewatched the series?](%7Boption%7D)

> 
> hehe.
> I'm glad we finally found out what happened to Shelbus.
> 
> Am I the only one who rewatched the series?

Of course! A year is too long to go without rewatching the series at least ONCE.

Can this be moved away to fanworks?

Also, I think the idea of kerbals doing battle is atrocious, real life has enough fighting and killing, cant we keep kerbals innocent while they explore the universe?

> 
> Can this be moved away to fanworks?
> Also, I think the idea of kerbals doing battle is atrocious, real life has enough fighting and killing, cant we keep kerbals innocent while they explore the universe?

When you have been everywhere the game has to offer and then some(outer planets mod) the only thing left to do is kill every kerbal you can get your hands on.

> 
> Can this be moved away to fanworks?
> Also, I think the idea of kerbals doing battle is atrocious, real life has enough fighting and killing, cant we keep kerbals innocent while they explore the universe?

Trust me- in comparison to some role playing groups Macey's stories are "kind". \*cough\* Kerbal Powers \*cough\*

> 
> Can this be moved away to fanworks?
> Also, I think the idea of kerbals doing battle is atrocious, real life has enough fighting and killing, cant we keep kerbals innocent while they explore the universe?

While I like the idea of Kerbals being peaceful, there's always some that are violent. And the violent ones need to be stopped, which requires weapons.

Macey is back, guys! This is going to be great!
Woohoo! He's back! HYPE!

> 
> Can this be moved away to fanworks?
> Also, I think the idea of kerbals doing battle is atrocious, real life has enough fighting and killing, cant we keep kerbals innocent while they explore the universe?

\*hits with SRB\*

> 
> Can this be moved away to fanworks?

I mean wow, I watched the vid but ehh underwhelming. I know it's a lot of work to produce, but why? I think I won't be on this train.

> 
> I mean wow, I watched the vid but ehh underwhelming. I know it's a lot of work to produce, but why? I think I won't be on this train.

Your loss mate. 

All aboard the MaceyDean Hypetrain!!! Now taking you to Laythe!
The King returns!!!

> 
> hehe.
> I'm glad we finally found out what happened to Shelbus.
> 
> Am I the only one who rewatched the series?

I rewatched it. It's amazing how much the series evolved as it went on. It's like he stumbled across the story and just ran with it. That season one ending is still oddly powerful.

> 
> While I like the idea of Kerbals being peaceful, there's always some that are violent. And the violent ones need to be stopped, which requires weapons.
> Macey is back, guys! This is going to be great!

In the series the idea is that they are peaceful explorers that have to stand their ground against the evil Hanlon Corperation. A bit like Star Trek is about exploring the universe and bettering humanity and how things sooner or later involve guns and big sticks.

> 
> I rewatched it. It's amazing how much the series evolved as it went on. It's like he stumbled across the story and just ran with it. That season one ending is still oddly powerful.

I completely agree. I think it's the fact that the story is let off the rails. The outcome is undecided, and that you've got Macey going up against serious firepower. He pushed himself, and it paid off in spades. And it ties in well with the story. I always thought the whole sequence with Shelbus and the Isprit was very well done, and the way that the whole 'traitor' arc developed was excellent. It was never cheesy, or melodramatic, or pushed on the audiance; just something he mentioned and spoke about occasionally. And then it blows up all at once. It worked so well. 

Of course, the ultimate storytelling trick is that Macey went and vanished for a year and now we've all got nostalgia ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T21:59:48Z" title="05/07/2015 09:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by Asmayus**

> 
> guns and big sticks.

My favorite type of tools.

![gPEw3uA.png](http://i.imgur.com/gPEw3uA.png)

I guess now that Maceys back we should prepare our ships for submissions!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T22:09:51Z" title="05/07/2015 10:09  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by ImperialistPigDog**

![4ntOLpDh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4ntOLpDh.jpg)

Same.

> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/4ntOLpDh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4ntOLpDh.jpg)
> Same.

Sleek looking ship my friend! That's an interesting looking weapon system, hows it work?

> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/4ntOLpDh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4ntOLpDh.jpg)
> Same.

same

![U65RO5v.png](http://i.imgur.com/U65RO5v.png)
Its going to be hard getting these capital ships places. The new LV-N has some major issues, I feel like refueling stations are going to be key in getting these large ships to other planets.

A skipper(not a mainsail for a reason) adds 230m/s of velocity to the round instantly allowing point-blank fire, focused aiming, and high accuracy as a result.

![9c5W8UZh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9c5W8UZh.jpg)

The system (Wilhelm line) was supposed to be put into service on a ship in spirit of kerbin but as macey is back and has his own ships that's a no. KSS-Hawk. I'll be including the rest with my submissions.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T22:52:49Z" title="05/07/2015 10:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by Spartwo**

> 
> A skipper(not a skipper for a reason) adds 230m/s of velocity to the round instantly allowing point-blank fire, focused aiming, and high accuracy as a result.
> [http://i.imgur.com/9c5W8UZh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9c5W8UZh.jpg)
> 
> The system was supposed to be put into service on a ship in spirit of kerbin but as macey is back and has his own ships that's a no. KSS-Hawk.

So the Skipper accelerates the round, Is this a one shot deal?

I'm not a military person, but Macey's series is very enjoyable. Hopefully he does narrative like it used to be. Maybe we will even see some more collaboration with Suestra? And in multiplayer? Who knows

> 
> So the Skipper accelerates the round, Is this a one shot deal?

No reloads but 10 individual shots, a shotgun blast jams the barrel.

> 
> I'm not a military person, but Macey's series is very enjoyable. Hopefully he does narrative like it used to be. Maybe we will even see some more collaboration with Suestra? And in multiplayer? Who knows

I would enjoy seeing him do more collaborations. BTW dose anyone know if he has a forum account?

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> No reloads but 10 individual shots, a shotgun blast jams the barrel.

Space shot gun, pure awesomeness...
